title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Kings chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Kings Chapter 10.

questions.question: How many sons did Ahab have in Samaria according to 2 Kings 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:1 states that Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria.

questions.question: Who wrote letters to the rulers of Jezreel demanding loyalty?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:1 says Jehu wrote letters and sent them to Samaria to the rulers of Jezreel.

questions.question: What did Jehu instruct the rulers to do with Ahab's sons in his second letter?
options: Take their heads and send them to him
Make one king from among them
questions.correctAnswer: Take their heads and send them to him
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:6 states Jehu asked for the heads of the king's sons to be brought to him.

questions.question: What was Jehu's reaction when the heads of Ahab's sons were brought to him?
options: He laid them in two heaps at the gate
questions.correctAnswer: He laid them in two heaps at the gate
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:8 records Jehu ordering the heads to be laid in two heaps at the gate until morning.

questions.question: True or False: Jehu conspired against his master Ahab and killed him according to 2 Kings 10.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:9 shows Jehu admitting he conspired against and killed his master Ahab.

questions.question: Where did Jehu kill the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah?
options: At the pit of the shearing house
questions.correctAnswer: At the pit of the shearing house
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:14 states Jehu slew them at the pit of the shearing house.

questions.question: Who greeted Jehu and asked if his heart was right with his own?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehonadab son of Rechab
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:15 shows Jehonadab meeting Jehu and asking if his heart was right with his.

questions.question: What did Jehu say about Ahab's service to Baal compared to his own?
options: Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will serve him much
Ahab served Baal much, Jehu served little
questions.correctAnswer: Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will serve him much
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:18 records Jehu saying Ahab served Baal a little; Jehu will serve him much.

questions.question: How did Jehu gather and kill the worshippers of Baal?
options: He invited them to a solemn assembly and then had them killed
questions.correctAnswer: He invited them to a solemn assembly and then had them killed
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:19-25 describes Jehu calling a solemn assembly for Baal worshippers and then killing them.

questions.question: What did Jehu do to the house and image of Baal?
options: Burned the images and broke down the house
Made them into a temple for the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Burned the images and broke down the house
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:26-27 shows Jehu burning the images and breaking down the house of Baal.

questions.question: True or False: Jehu completely removed the sins of Jeroboam from Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:29 states Jehu did not depart from the sins of Jeroboam involving golden calves.

questions.question: What reward did the LORD give Jehu for carrying out His will against Ahab's house?
options: His children for four generations would sit on Israel's throne
questions.correctAnswer: His children for four generations would sit on Israel's throne
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:30 says the LORD promised Jehu's children would reign for four generations.

questions.question: Who smote Israel in all the coasts during Jehu's days?
questions.correctAnswer: Hazael
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:32 explains that the LORD began to cut Israel short and Hazael smote them in all coasts.

questions.question: True or False: Jehu fully obeyed the law of the LORD God of Israel with all his heart.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:31 states Jehu did not walk fully in the law of the LORD with all his heart.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And Jehu slept with his fathers: and they buried him in ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Samaria
questions.explanation: 2 Kings 10:35 records Jehu was buried in Samaria.

medium.title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Kings Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is facing fear and uncertainty in leadership decisions. Based on Jehu's approach in 2 Kings 10, what biblical truth can encourage them?
options: Trust in God's plan and obey His commands even when others are afraid
Avoid making decisions to prevent conflict
Rely solely on human wisdom for leadership choices
Wait for others to act first before taking a stand
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God's plan and obey His commands even when others are afraid
questions.explanation: Jehu boldly acted on God's direction despite others' fear (2 Kings 10:4-5, 10:9-10, 10:17). This teaches us to trust God and obey His commands courageously.

questions.question: How does 2 Kings 10 demonstrate the importance of obedience to God's word through Jehu's actions?
options: Jehu faithfully executed God's judgment on Ahab's house and Baal worshippers
Jehu sought political alliances to secure his reign
Jehu ignored God's commands and ruled selfishly
Jehu compromised with Baal worshippers for peace
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu faithfully executed God's judgment on Ahab's house and Baal worshippers
questions.explanation: Jehu obeyed God's word by destroying Ahab's household and Baal worshippers as prophesied (2 Kings 10:10-11, 10:25-28, 10:30). This shows the blessing of obedience.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with zeal for God in their daily life. What example from 2 Kings 10 can inspire them to renew their commitment?
options: Jehu showed zeal for the Lord by actively rooting out evil and idolatry
Jehu waited passively for others to act first
Jehu ignored the sins around him
Jehu sought to please people rather than God
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu showed zeal for the Lord by actively rooting out evil and idolatry
questions.explanation: Jehu's passionate zeal for God is evident in his actions against Baal worship (2 Kings 10:15-16, 10:19-28). This encourages believers to be proactive in spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does Jehu's interaction with Jehonadab teach us about fellowship and unity in the church?
options: Jehu sought fellowship with someone whose heart aligned with his, showing unity in faith
Jehu rejected those who did not share his views
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu sought fellowship with someone whose heart aligned with his, showing unity in faith
questions.explanation: Jehu and Jehonadab united in their zeal for the Lord (2 Kings 10:15-16), demonstrating the value of fellowship and shared commitment in serving God.

questions.question: A believer asks how to deal with persistent sin in their life. What warning from Jehu's story in 2 Kings 10 would you share?
options: Partial obedience leaves room for sin to continue, as Jehu did not fully depart from Jeroboam's sins
Ignore the sin and focus on other areas
Sin is not important as long as you do some good deeds
Waiting for the right time is better than immediate change
questions.correctAnswer: Partial obedience leaves room for sin to continue, as Jehu did not fully depart from Jeroboam's sins
questions.explanation: Though Jehu did well in some areas, he did not fully walk in God's law (2 Kings 10:29-31). This highlights the need for wholehearted obedience to overcome sin.

questions.question: What practical lesson about stewardship and integrity can be drawn from Jehu's decisive actions in executing justice?
options: One must faithfully carry out responsibilities entrusted by God with integrity
Avoid responsibility when it is difficult
questions.correctAnswer: One must faithfully carry out responsibilities entrusted by God with integrity
questions.explanation: Jehu faithfully executed God's judgment without compromise (2 Kings 10:11, 10:17, 10:30), teaching integrity and faithfulness in duties.

questions.question: True or False: Jehu's reign was marked by complete obedience to God's law without any failure.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jehu did not fully obey God's law because he continued the sins of Jeroboam with the golden calves (2 Kings 10:29, 10:31), showing that even faithful servants can have shortcomings.

questions.question: What does Jehu’s destruction of Baal worship teach us about the importance of spiritual discipline in the church?
options: Remove all forms of idolatry and false teaching to maintain purity
Tolerate all beliefs for the sake of unity
Ignore false teachings hoping they will disappear
Focus only on personal spirituality without church discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Remove all forms of idolatry and false teaching to maintain purity
questions.explanation: Jehu’s thorough destruction of Baal worship (2 Kings 10:25-28) shows the need to maintain spiritual purity through discipline in the church.

questions.question: How does Jehu’s example in 2 Kings 10 encourage believers to persevere through trials when confronting evil?
options: Jehu persevered in carrying out God's will despite risks and opposition
Jehu gave up when faced with challenges
Jehu waited for others to act first
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu persevered in carrying out God's will despite risks and opposition
questions.explanation: Jehu boldly confronted evil and fulfilled God's commands despite danger (2 Kings 10:6-11, 10:25), teaching perseverance through trials.

questions.question: A believer struggles with bitterness toward those who have wronged them. Based on Jehu’s actions, what biblical principle about forgiveness and justice could you share?
options: Justice should be carried out according to God's word, but personal bitterness should be avoided
questions.correctAnswer: Justice should be carried out according to God's word, but personal bitterness should be avoided
questions.explanation: Jehu executed God's judgment faithfully (2 Kings 10:10-11), showing justice is important. However, Scripture elsewhere calls believers to avoid personal bitterness, balancing justice with love.

questions.question: True or False: Jehu's descendants were promised a lasting dynasty because of his obedience to God's commands.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: God promised Jehu that his children of the fourth generation would sit on Israel's throne because of his obedience in executing judgment (2 Kings 10:30).

questions.question: How does Jehu’s strategy in inviting all Baal worshippers to a solemn assembly demonstrate wisdom in evangelism and spiritual warfare?
options: Jehu used subtlety to gather and remove false worshippers effectively
Jehu openly confronted Baal worship without planning
Jehu avoided confronting false worship to keep peace
Jehu converted Baal worshippers through gentle persuasion
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu used subtlety to gather and remove false worshippers effectively
questions.explanation: Jehu proclaimed a solemn assembly to gather Baal worshippers so he could destroy them (2 Kings 10:19-21), showing strategic spiritual discipline.

questions.question: A believer wants to serve God more zealously. Based on Jehu’s words and actions, what practical advice can you give?
options: Demonstrate your zeal through active obedience and decisive action for God
Limit your service to comfortable activities
Wait for others to lead before acting
questions.correctAnswer: Demonstrate your zeal through active obedience and decisive action for God
questions.explanation: Jehu invited Jehonadab to see his zeal and demonstrated it by actively removing idolatry (2 Kings 10:16-17, 10:18-20), teaching believers to serve God with commitment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jehu's reign over Israel in Samaria lasted for ______ years.
questions.explanation: The chapter states Jehu reigned for twenty and eight years (2 Kings 10:36).

questions.question: What does the way Jehu dealt with the children of Ahaziah reveal about the seriousness of obedience and consequences?
options: Jehu took strict action against those opposing God's plan to ensure obedience
Jehu spared all relatives to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu took strict action against those opposing God's plan to ensure obedience
questions.explanation: Jehu killed the brethren of Ahaziah who came to salute the king's children (2 Kings 10:13-14), showing that disobedience and opposition to God's plan have serious consequences.

hard.title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Kings Chapter 10.

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of Jehu's letters sent to the rulers of Jezreel and the caretakers of Ahab's sons?
options: To invite them to a feast
To order them to set Ahab's son on the throne
To warn them about an impending invasion
questions.correctAnswer: To order them to set Ahab's son on the throne
questions.explanation: Jehu wrote letters commanding them to look out the best of Ahab's sons and set him on his father's throne (2 Kings 10:1-3).

questions.question: How did the rulers and caretakers of Ahab's sons respond to Jehu's initial letter?
options: They obeyed and crowned a son of Ahab
They expressed fear and sought to appease Jehu
questions.correctAnswer: They expressed fear and sought to appease Jehu
questions.explanation: They were exceedingly afraid and sent word to Jehu that they would obey him and not make any king, leaving the decision to Jehu (2 Kings 10:4-5).

questions.question: What action did Jehu command in his second letter to the caretakers of Ahab's sons?
options: To send the heads of Ahab's sons to him at Jezreel
To prepare a feast for Jehu
To gather the sons for a peace treaty
To flee the city with Ahab's sons
questions.correctAnswer: To send the heads of Ahab's sons to him at Jezreel
questions.explanation: Jehu instructed them to cut off the heads of the king's sons and bring them to him at Jezreel (2 Kings 10:6).

questions.question: What was Jehu's response when he saw the heads of Ahab's sons piled at the gate?
options: He wept for the fallen princes
He praised the Lord for justice
He acknowledged his own conspiracy but questioned who killed the rest
He immediately crowned one of the sons
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledged his own conspiracy but questioned who killed the rest
questions.explanation: Jehu stated he conspired against his master and slew him but questioned who had slain all these others (2 Kings 10:9).

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by Jehu's statement about the word of the LORD falling to the earth?
options: The fulfillment of prophetic judgment against Ahab's house
The mercy of God towards Israel
The rise of a new dynasty without divine approval
questions.correctAnswer: The fulfillment of prophetic judgment against Ahab's house
questions.explanation: Jehu declared that nothing of the word of the LORD against Ahab's house had failed, fulfilling Elijah's prophecy (2 Kings 10:10).

questions.question: Jehu's killing of Ahaziah's brothers and their number is recorded as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty-two men
questions.explanation: Jehu killed forty-two men who were brothers of Ahaziah king of Judah at the pit of the shearing house (2 Kings 10:14).

questions.question: The meeting between Jehu and Jehonadab is significant because Jehonadab was from which family or group?
questions.correctAnswer: The sons of Rechab
questions.explanation: Jehonadab was the son of Rechab, a family known for their zeal and faithfulness, symbolizing an alliance (2 Kings 10:15).

questions.question: Jehu's destruction of Baal worshippers involved what cunning strategy?
options: A public debate challenging Baal priests
A secret night raid on Baal's temple
Inviting all Baal worshippers to a solemn assembly and then killing them
Bribing Baal priests to leave the city
questions.correctAnswer: Inviting all Baal worshippers to a solemn assembly and then killing them
questions.explanation: Jehu proclaimed a solemn assembly to which all Baal worshippers came, then ordered their massacre to destroy Baal worship in Israel (2 Kings 10:19-25).

questions.question: What symbolism is found in Jehu breaking down the house of Baal and turning it into a latrine?
options: An act of purification for the city
A symbolic declaration of Baal's total rejection and humiliation
Preparing the site for a new temple
A common practice to honor Baal
questions.correctAnswer: A symbolic declaration of Baal's total rejection and humiliation
questions.explanation: Breaking down the temple and making it a latrine symbolized utter contempt and rejection of Baal (2 Kings 10:27).

questions.question: Despite Jehu's zeal against Baal worship, what sin did he persist in according to the text?
options: Ignoring the golden calves at Bethel and Dan
questions.correctAnswer: Ignoring the golden calves at Bethel and Dan
questions.explanation: Jehu did not depart from the sin of Jeroboam, namely the golden calves at Bethel and Dan (2 Kings 10:29).

questions.question: What promise did the LORD make to Jehu as a reward for his actions against Ahab's house?
options: His children would reign for four generations
questions.correctAnswer: His children would reign for four generations
questions.explanation: God promised Jehu that his descendants up to the fourth generation would sit on Israel's throne (2 Kings 10:30).

questions.question: Which foreign king is mentioned as having smitten Israel during Jehu's reign, signifying divine judgment?
questions.correctAnswer: Hazael
questions.explanation: The LORD began to cut Israel short by allowing Hazael to strike them in various territories (2 Kings 10:32).

questions.question: How long did Jehu reign over Israel according to this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 28 years
questions.explanation: Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-eight years (2 Kings 10:36).

questions.question: True or False: Jehu fully obeyed the law of the LORD with all his heart throughout his reign.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The text states Jehu did not walk in the law of the LORD with all his heart, continuing in the sins of Jeroboam (2 Kings 10:31).

questions.question: What literary device is exemplified by Jehu's actions fulfilling Elijah's prophecy against Ahab's house?
questions.correctAnswer: Typology
questions.explanation: Jehu's fulfillment of Elijah's prophecy represents typology, where historical events fulfill earlier prophetic patterns (2 Kings 10:10, 17).

theological.title: 2 Kings Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Kings Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was Jehu’s primary motivation for killing the sons of Ahab and destroying his house?
options: To fulfill the word of the LORD spoken by Elijah
To seize the throne for himself
To gain favor with the people of Israel
To punish Ahab for his sins
questions.correctAnswer: To fulfill the word of the LORD spoken by Elijah
questions.explanation: Jehu explicitly states that his actions fulfill the word of the LORD concerning the house of Ahab, confirming divine judgment in accordance with prophecy (2 Kings 10:10, 2 Kings 10:11). This reflects God's sovereignty and faithfulness to His prophetic word, consistent with God’s justice as seen in Deuteronomy 32:35, Romans 12:19, and Hebrews 10:30.

questions.question: How does 2 Kings 10 portray the character of Jehu in relation to zeal for the LORD?
options: He is zealous but does not fully obey God's law
He is indifferent to God's commands
He perfectly keeps the law of the LORD
He rejects the LORD and serves Baal
questions.correctAnswer: He is zealous but does not fully obey God's law
questions.explanation: Jehu demonstrates zeal by eradicating Baal worship and fulfilling God's judgment (2 Kings 10:16, 10:28), but he fails to depart from the sins of Jeroboam, showing incomplete obedience (2 Kings 10:29, 10:31). This tension highlights the difference between zeal and true heart obedience as emphasized in 1 Samuel 15:22 and Romans 10:2.

questions.question: What theological theme is highlighted by Jehu’s destruction of Baal worship in Israel?
options: The exclusivity of worship due to God’s holiness
questions.correctAnswer: The exclusivity of worship due to God’s holiness
questions.explanation: Jehu’s eradication of Baal worship demonstrates God’s demand for exclusive devotion, emphasizing His holiness and intolerance of idolatry (2 Kings 10:18-28). This aligns with the First Commandment (Exodus 20:3), Isaiah 44:6, and New Testament teaching in 1 Corinthians 10:14 about avoiding idolatry.

questions.question: According to 2 Kings 10, what is the consequence for those who do not obey Jehu’s command during the Baal assembly?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not live
questions.explanation: Jehu threatens death to anyone absent from the Baal assembly, demonstrating the seriousness of his plan to destroy Baal worshippers (2 Kings 10:19). This severity reflects the biblical principle of covenant faithfulness and judgment on idolatry (Leviticus 20:2-5, Deuteronomy 13:6-10).

questions.question: What promise does the LORD give Jehu because of his actions against the house of Ahab?
options: His descendants will sit on the throne of Israel for four generations
He will have a long life
He will build a great temple
questions.correctAnswer: His descendants will sit on the throne of Israel for four generations
questions.explanation: God affirms Jehu’s partial obedience by promising a dynastic reward for four generations (2 Kings 10:30). This illustrates God's sovereign grace despite incomplete obedience, a theme echoed in the Davidic covenant (2 Samuel 7:12-16) and the concept of covenant blessings (Deuteronomy 28).

questions.question: Jehu’s failure to depart from the sins of Jeroboam primarily involved what?
options: The continued worship of golden calves in Bethel and Dan
questions.correctAnswer: The continued worship of golden calves in Bethel and Dan
questions.explanation: Jehu did not remove the idolatrous golden calves, perpetuating Jeroboam’s sin (2 Kings 10:29, 10:31). This shows that despite zeal, incomplete repentance can preserve sin, a principle seen in the warnings against partial obedience in 1 Kings 12:28-30 and Amos 5:21-24.

questions.question: How does Jehu’s reign illustrate God’s justice and mercy simultaneously?
options: God judges Ahab’s house but preserves Jehu’s dynasty for a time
God rewards Jehu with eternal life
God ignores the sins of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God judges Ahab’s house but preserves Jehu’s dynasty for a time
questions.explanation: God’s justice is evident in the destruction of Ahab’s house (2 Kings 10:11), while mercy appears in the promise of Jehu’s descendants reigning four generations (2 Kings 10:30). This balance is consistent with God's character as revealed in Exodus 34:6-7 and Romans 11:22.

questions.question: What does Jehu’s interaction with Jehonadab son of Rechab signify in the theological context?
options: A covenantal alliance based on shared zeal for the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: A covenantal alliance based on shared zeal for the LORD
questions.explanation: Jehu’s handshake with Jehonadab symbolizes a covenant of mutual commitment to God’s cause (2 Kings 10:15). This reflects biblical covenants as expressions of faith and unity, paralleling covenants in Genesis 15:18 and Psalm 25:14.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jehu’s method of destroying Baal worshippers 'in subtilty'?
options: It shows strategic wisdom in executing God’s judgment
It implies a lack of zeal
questions.correctAnswer: It shows strategic wisdom in executing God’s judgment
questions.explanation: Jehu’s subtle approach to gathering Baal worshippers shows strategic wisdom in fulfilling divine judgment (2 Kings 10:19). This aligns with biblical examples of wise strategy, such as Nehemiah’s rebuilding efforts (Nehemiah 4:13) and Jesus’ parables (Matthew 13:10-17).

questions.question: How does 2 Kings 10 illustrate the theme of divine sovereignty over human kings and kingdoms?
options: God raises and removes kings to accomplish His purposes
Kings reign by their own power alone
God is indifferent to earthly rulers
questions.correctAnswer: God raises and removes kings to accomplish His purposes
questions.explanation: Jehu’s rise and execution of judgment against Ahab’s house demonstrate God’s sovereign control over rulers (2 Kings 10:11-17). This is consistent with biblical theology of God’s sovereignty over nations (Daniel 2:21, Romans 13:1, Proverbs 21:1).

questions.question: What does the destruction of Baal’s image and house symbolize theologically?
options: The complete rejection of idolatry and vindication of Yahweh’s supremacy
The acceptance of Baal worship alongside Yahweh
questions.correctAnswer: The complete rejection of idolatry and vindication of Yahweh’s supremacy
questions.explanation: Jehu’s destruction of Baal’s images and temple (2 Kings 10:26-27) symbolizes the purging of idolatry and affirmation of God’s exclusive worship, consistent with Isaiah 46:5-7 and 1 Corinthians 8:4-6.

questions.question: What doctrinal lesson about prophecy and divine promise is demonstrated by Jehu’s actions in 2 Kings 10?
options: God’s promises and prophecies are certain and will be fulfilled
Prophecies are conditional and often not fulfilled
Prophecy has no real impact on history
questions.correctAnswer: God’s promises and prophecies are certain and will be fulfilled
questions.explanation: Jehu’s fulfillment of Elijah’s prophecy concerning Ahab’s house (2 Kings 10:10, 17) confirms the certainty and faithfulness of God’s word, a core Christian doctrine affirmed in 2 Timothy 3:16 and Hebrews 1:1-2.

questions.question: How does the account of Jehu’s reign relate to the doctrine of covenant faithfulness?
options: Jehu partially fulfills covenant obligations but fails in full obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Jehu partially fulfills covenant obligations but fails in full obedience
questions.explanation: Jehu’s zeal to destroy Baal worship shows covenant faithfulness, but his failure to remove golden calf worship signifies incomplete obedience (2 Kings 10:29-31), reflecting the biblical tension between law and grace seen in Romans 7 and Judges 2:11-19.

questions.question: What does the killing of Ahaziah’s brethren by Jehu indicate about the nature of divine judgment and human responsibility?
options: God’s judgment often involves judgment upon related political entities
Human responsibility is irrelevant in divine judgment
questions.correctAnswer: God’s judgment often involves judgment upon related political entities
questions.explanation: Jehu’s killing of Ahaziah’s brethren (2 Kings 10:14) shows that divine judgment can extend to political alliances and related parties, emphasizing the corporate nature of sin and responsibility, as in Ezekiel 18:20 and Romans 1:18-32.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jehu’s reign lasting twenty-eight years as recorded in 2 Kings 10:36?
options: It reflects God’s providential control over Israel’s history
It shows instability in Israel’s leadership
It suggests a short, insignificant reign
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects God’s providential control over Israel’s history
questions.explanation: The record of Jehu’s twenty-eight-year reign marks a divinely ordained period, signifying God’s providential governance (2 Kings 10:36), consistent with biblical historiography that highlights God’s control over kings’ reigns (1 Chronicles 29:11; Daniel 4:17).
